timeAnchors.definition: Week 0 of maintenance (M-0 visit), which serves as the baseline for the maintenance study phase
timeAnchors.sourceText: The previous endpoint of corticosteroid-free remission at Week 44 in subjects induced into clinical response with ustekinumab and receiving corticosteroids at Week 0 of maintenance has been moved to the Other Secondary Endpoints section.

repetitions.exitCondition: Loss of Response or Clinical Flare
repetitions.sourceText: Maintenance Study ... Management of Clinical Flare and Loss of Response

traversalConstraints.sourceText: [{'condition': 'Clinical Flare or Loss of Response', 'path': ['MAINTENANCE_STUDY_ADJUSTMENT']}, {'condition': 'Adverse Event or Discontinuation', 'path': ['EARLY_TERMINATION', 'SAFETY_FOLLOW_UP']}]

executionTypes.rationale: Conducted once at the start of the study to determine eligibility.
The protocol describes an induction phase which typically involves a single loading dose or initial treatment event.
Maintenance therapy involves scheduled repeats of the study drug at specific intervals (e.g., every 8 or 12 weeks).
The Time and Events schedules for Induction and Maintenance indicate these are repeated at multiple study visits.
Scheduled repeated assessments over the duration of the extension phase.

footnoteConditions.text: a: Based on testing the SC ustekinumab 90 mg q8w group versus placebo at α=0.05 (2-sided).
footnoteConditions.sourceText: a: Based on testing the SC ustekinumab 90 mg q8w group versus placebo at α=0.05 (2-sided).

footnoteConditions.text: b: It is estimated that about 37% of subjects in the primary population (40 subjects per treatment group) will be in clinical remission at Week 0 of maintenance.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Clinical Remission (Induction)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Mayo score <= 2 AND no individual subscore > 1
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Total Mayo score of 0 to 2 points and no individual subscore greater than 1 point
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: The primary endpoint for the induction study is clinical remission at Week 8.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Clinical Remission (Maintenance)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Mayo score <= 2 AND no individual subscore > 1
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Clinical remission at Week 44 among subjects who were in clinical response at maintenance baseline
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: The primary endpoint for the maintenance study is clinical remission at Week 44.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Clinical Response (Induction)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: (Baseline Mayo - Week 8 Mayo >= 3 AND reduction >= 30%) AND (Rectal bleeding subscore reduction >= 1 OR absolute score <= 1)
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: A decrease from baseline in the Mayo score by >= 30% and >= 3 points, with either a decrease from baseline in the rectal bleeding subscore >= 1 or a rectal bleeding subscore of 0 or 1
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Clinical response at Week 8 is a secondary endpoint.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Endoscopic Healing
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Endoscopic healing (Mayo endoscopy subscore of 0 or 1) at Week 8.

derivedVariables.name: Mayo Score
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Sum of 4 subscores (stool frequency + rectal bleeding + PGA + endoscopy findings)
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Calculated at baseline to determine eligibility and disease severity

derivedVariables.name: Final Reported Endoscopic Subscore
derivedVariables.derivationRule: If local and central reader 1 agree, use that score. If they disagree, use the median score of the local read, central read 1, and central read 2.
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Used to determine subject eligibility at baseline
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Baseline, Week 8/16 (Induction), and Loss of Response (Maintenance)

derivedVariables.name: Clinical Remission
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Binary (Yes/No) based on Mayo score thresholds; US-specific definition used for US subjects in the fourth major secondary endpoint.
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Status at maintenance baseline as determined by IWRS

derivedVariables.name: Loss of Clinical Response
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Determined by endoscopy (sigmoidoscopy) following a clinical flare; if endoscopy is declined, assessed via partial Mayo response 16 weeks after initial flare.

doseModifications: Management of clinical flare and loss of response
